hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Selloff
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >5% intraday drop on negative macro news (US budget crisis, regulatory headlines), but funding rates remain neutral/positive and spot volumes spike >150% of 20-day average, price will revert 70% of the drop within 48 hours as liquidity providers absorb panic selling.
hypothesis_content.rationale: October's liquidity crash created structural gaps that get over-exploited by news-driven panic. When funding remains neutral, it suggests no systematic deleveraging, just spot selling. Market makers and liquidity providers step in to capture spreads during these dislocations.
entry_conditions: Aggregated funding rates across major exchanges between -0.005% and +0.01%

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 70% retracement of the initial drop
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes new low below entry candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such events lead to continued selling beyond 48 hours with funding turning negative
